item.title: “I’ve Got Nothing to Lose”: Consumers’ Risk Perceptions and Protective Actions after the Equifax Data Breach
Contact
item.description: The easiest way to contact me is through email. Feel free to shoot me an email at abraham dot mhaidli at mpi-sp dot org. I will answer as soon as I can. In the meanwhile, feel free to find me in the following: Google Scholar Profile: Where (almost) all my citations live Twitter: AbrahamMhaidli BlueSky: abrahammhaidli LinkedIn: My LinkedIn Profile

item.title: Identifying Manipulative Advertising Techniques in XR Through Scenario Construction

Listen Only When Spoken To: Interpersonal Communication Cues as Smart Speaker Privacy Controls

Shockvertising, Malware, and a Lack of Accountability: Exploring Consumer Risks of Virtual Reality Advertisements and Marketing Experiences
item.description: This is a high level summary of the paper. It is deliberately informal, casual, and only talks about the high level points from the paper. For full details about the study, please refer to the full paper, which can be found here. Motivation of Study The goal of this study was to get a better understanding of how VR ads could be harmful. There has already been work studying and thinking about VR advertising and how they can hurt users (incluing some of my own work).

item.title: We Cant Live Without Them! App Developer's Adoption of Ad Networks and Their Considerations of Consumer Risks
